main.name: loader
main.description: `Game.loader` makes it easy to download assets that are needed for your game. When the first Game is created on the page, a `<div>` with id `2D-loaders` will be added at the bottom of the DOM. All games will place a `<div>` with class `2D-loader` inside this `<div>`. With `Game.loader.load()`, the appropriate elements will be placed inside the respective `2D-loader` `<div>`.

children.name: load
children.description: Load the file at the given URL. Optionally specify a name to refer to it later. All loaded assets can always be retrieved based on their URL or their optional name. `Game.loader.load()` will create a DOM element inside the Game's `2D-loader` `div` (an `` for an image etc.).

arguments.name: URL
arguments.description: The URL of the file to download. Will be passed directly to the XHR request, so

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: An optional name to easily retrieve the file later on.

children.name: get
children.description: Get the file with the given name or URL.

arguments.name: URL/name
arguments.description:
The name or URL of the file to get. This always returns a DOM element from the `2D-loader` `
` (an `` for image etc.).

children.name: add
children.description: Add a file to the loader. Provided just for easy and centralized 'storage'. `Game.loader.add()` will create the same situation as described in the `Game.loader` description.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description: The file to add to the loader.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The (unique) name of the file, so you can retrieve it later from the loader.
